newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asian crude firmer, Oman differentials talked down.
newsitem.headline: Asian crude firmer, Oman differentials talked down.

text.p: Asian crude prices were firmer on Wednesday but Oman differentials were being talked lower, in what some said was a tactic to spook the market.

Overnight Brent and NYMEX futures surged as prices broke out of their previous range. A barge accident on the Mississippi river in the U.S., which has closed down the river to barge traffic, added to the bullish tone.
But physical trading in Asia remained subdued.
Oman was heard twice traded at MPM -2/3 cents.
However, traders were sceptical of the trades because one of the sellers denied his deal.
And traders said the other deal could have been talked to spook the market and get prices lower.
Traders assessed Oman around flat to MPM.
Other Middle East grades were quiet.
Minas crude for April was offered by producers at flat to ICP, but few bidders were on show amid expectations of an overhang of the crude in April.
Tapis remained on offer from a producer at quotes plus $1.00 and a major was offering a late April Cossack crude, aiming to achieve a premium in the 20s.
